metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the Councillor Florrick in Wyrm Rock Prison.You can release Florrick. If you do so, she'll ask you to help her escape. First, you need to open the prison cell. You can find the key to the cell in the inventory of one of the guards.Second, you need to help Florrick escape the prison.There are two ways of doing so:1) Killing all guards in Prison, Flaming Fist Office and one of the bridges.2) Finding a secret tunnel in the janitor's closet.
metadata.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_Agoto 47; 8; -696Find a prison cell with Florrick.Talk with Florick.

4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

21.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick turns her head to the player. Absolutely demoralised.

138.speaker: Player
138.context: NodeContext: Sees his ally imprisoned and on her last legs

161.speaker: Wyll
161.context: NodeContext: Sees his ally imprisoned and on her last legs

118.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
118.text: Wyll? Is that you? What curse has befallen you?
118.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

85.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
85.text: No matter. The city, the future. It's done.
85.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

76.speaker: Player
76.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

70.speaker: Player
70.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: I don't understand. What do you mean?
151.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: You're talking drivel. I'm getting you out of here.
116.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

129.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
129.text: You don't get it. We lost.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: So you're giving up, just like that?
80.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

33.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
33.text: I didn't give up. I lost.
33.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

110.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
110.text: I came seeking allies to our cause. Watchers spotted me, dragged me to Ulder Ravengard's husk.
110.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.
87.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

130.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
130.text: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.
130.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.
14.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
7.text: Empty as a stare. A tadpole's puppet, nothing more.
7.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

157.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
157.text: He spoke in accusations. Apostasy, conspiracy, sedition.
157.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

102.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
102.text: I'll be executed in five dawns.
102.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

43.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
43.text: I will soon be hanged on the city gallows to a chorus of cheers.
43.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

154.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
154.text: You might have unlocked my cell, but there's no escape from this place.
154.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: The Hells with that. Nothing is over. Not while I still draw breath.
108.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

150.speaker: Wyll
150.text: The Hells with that. Nothing is over. Not while I still draw breath.
150.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Father's alive, Florrick. All is not lost.
92.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Ravengard's in a safe place, Florrick. All is not lost.
94.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

153.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
153.text: Then - then there is hope yet. To think I'd all but given up.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Ravengard's in a safe place, Florrick. All is not lost.
124.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Ravengard's dead. The city needs you - I'm getting you out.
74.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

22.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
22.text: He's - dead? I prepared myself for this. Thought I was ready. But the sting still pierces deep.
22.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

123.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
123.text: He's - dead? I prepared myself for this. Thought I was ready. But the sting still pierces deep.
123.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

57.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
57.text: He - he once told me, 'When the people call for a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.'
57.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

117.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
117.text: He was right. No more waiting, no more sulking. I know what to do.
117.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

24.text: He's - dead? So perishes the city. I can - I can scarcely bear it.

11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
11.text: He's - dead? So perishes the city. I can - I can scarcely bear it.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I'm breaking you out. With Ravengard gone, Baldur's Gate needs you.
109.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I'm breaking you out. Baldur's Gate needs you. Ravengard needs you.
95.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

47.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
47.text: Forget it. Baldur's Gate's good as cinder. An illithid hive beyond saving.
47.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

112.text: Forget it. Baldur's Gate's good as cinder. An illithid hive beyond saving.
112.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

89.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
89.text: Forget it. Baldur's Gate's good as cinder. An illithid hive beyond saving.
89.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: *You recall the tales of Gorion's Ward, the great hero of Baldur's Gate. Without them, the city would have succumbed to war, famine, and worse.*
38.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

141.text: *You recall the tales of Gorion's Ward, the great hero of Baldur's Gate. Without them, the city would have succumbed to war, famine, and worse.*
141.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *You recall the tales of Gorion's Ward, the great hero of Baldur's Gate. Without them, the city would have succumbed to war, famine, and worse.*
52.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Gorion's Ward overcame great odds to protect the city. You can do the same.
72.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

98.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
98.text: 'When the people need a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.'
98.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

156.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
156.text: Indeed. To think I'd almost forgotten.

114.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
114.text: No more sulking. I know what to do. And I can only do it with the help of the Blade.

88.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
88.text: 'When the people need a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.' Ulder's words. I'd almost forgotten.
88.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

25.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
25.text: No more sulking. I know what to do.
25.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

145.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
145.text: Unlock my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.
145.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

54.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
54.text: Lead me from my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.
54.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

23.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
23.text: I'll seek out my connections. When the city's streets shatter, you'll want their blades.
23.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Agreed. I'll find a way to unlock your cell.
152.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

6.speaker: Player
6.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

90.speaker: Player
90.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

81.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
81.text: Damn you. Just as despair turned to hope.
81.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

180.speaker: Player
180.text: But - please. If what you said is true, Ravengard's not lost to us. Not yet.
180.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

84.speaker: Player
84.text: But - please. If what you said is true, Ravengard's not lost to us. Not yet.
84.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

173.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
173.text: But - please. If what you said is true, Ravengard's not lost to us. Not yet.
173.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

162.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
162.text: If you do battle, bind him. Knock him out. But spare him the blade.

163.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
163.text: There's more to your story, Wyll - and it's your father who needs to tell it.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Let's say I succeed, free his mind. Then what?

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: Let's say I succeed, free his mind. Then what?

10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
10.text: Then he'll point the way forward. There's more to your story, Wyll - and your father needs to tell it.

196.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
196.text: He is the life and light of Baldur's Gate. You deserve him. And he deserves his son.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: He is the life and light of Baldur's Gate. You deserve him. And he deserves his son.

19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
19.text: He is the life and light of Baldur's Gate. We deserve him. He deserves us.

191.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
191.text: Hells - is it true? I can't believe it. We've lost so much.

65.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
65.text: Then our hopes rest with you. May you find the will to keep the city safe.

1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
1.text: - and it rests wholly with you. I trust you'll be the beacon to which we all can rally.

193.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
193.text: The seasons change. So do minds. May yours find a way.
193.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I pull you from flames, and this is how you repay me? Find your courage and fight!
107.context: NodeContext: Blunt, pragmatic - calling us on our bullshit

160.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
160.text: What courage? I've bled my veins dry, cried my last tear.

131.text: What courage? I've bled my veins dry, cried my last tear.

136.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
136.text: What courage? I've bled my veins dry, cried my last tear.

17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
17.text: I'm sorry, Wyll. I've got nothing more to give.

166.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
166.text: I'm sorry. But there's no more I can give.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Coward. Balduran didn't build the Gate for you to weep as it burns.
103.context: NodeContext: Blunt, pragmatic - calling us on our bullshit

82.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
82.text: I am already called traitor. Call me coward, call me craven. I am forfeit already.

155.text: I am already called traitor. Call me coward, call me craven. I am forfeit already.

56.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
56.text: I am already called traitor. Call me coward, call me craven. I am forfeit already.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Fine, turn your back. I don't need you.
71.context: NodeContext: Blunt, pragmatic - calling us on our bullshit

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Are we so flush with friends that you would just cast one aside? If we are to win, we need her.
106.context: NodeContext: Blunt, pragmatic - calling us on our bullshit

115.speaker: Jaheira
115.text: Are we so flush with friends that you would just cast one aside? If we are to win, we need her.
115.context: NodeContext: Blunt, pragmatic - calling us on our bullshit

77.speaker: Player
77.text: We are all lost, gods have mercy.

83.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
83.text: We are all lost, gods have mercy.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You said you wouldn't give up. I'm setting you free and holding you to it.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Pathetic. I'm getting you out so I can beat some sense into you.

167.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
167.text: Heh - I'll give you credit. I'm drowning in tears, and you hold out a fist. Your father would've done the same.

78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
78.text: Heh - I'll give you credit. I'm drowning in tears, and you hold out a fist. Ulder would've done the same.

69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
69.text: 'When the people need a miracle', he said, 'you cannot wait for the gods to answer.' I'd almost forgotten.

134.text: Then beat me. Take my head, leave me rotting. Death is already my fate.

29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
29.text: Then beat me. Take my head, leave me rotting. Death is already my fate.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Ravengard's not lost. I felt him reach out to me.

127.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
127.text: You - you felt him? Extraordinary. Maybe what is lost... can be found.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I found your duke. I expect my reward.

53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
53.text: What reward? I am empty. Ravengard is tadpoled, beyond rescue. There is nothing to give.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I found your duke. He's dead, I'm sorry to say.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Is that so? Well - good luck with that.

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: Father is safe, Florrick. He is freed from the grip of the Absolute.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: The Fist can go hang themselves - we're getting you out.

35.speaker: Jaheira
35.text: The Fist can go hang themselves - we're getting you out.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Oh, don't be dramatic. I could unlock this cell blindfolded - you'll be out in no time.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Calm down, this cell was trivial to unlock. Getting out of here will be easy.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Florrick? What have they done to you?
61.context: NodeContext: Concern and trepidation - you're seeing an ally in a cell, and know the answer you're about to hear won't be good.

188.speaker: Jaheira
188.text: Florrick? What have they done to you?
188.context: NodeContext: Concern and trepidation - you're seeing an ally in a cell, and know the answer you're about to hear won't be good.

169.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
169.text: I don't speak of myself, High Harper. I speak of the city itself - we came too late. It's over.

45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
45.text: Ravengard is lost. I am lost.

50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
50.text: Wyll? What has become of you?
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

73.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

93.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
93.text: You might as well lock the cell. You're too late.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

99.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
99.text: Ravengard is lost. I am lost.
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

120.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
120.text: Jaheira? You're too late, High Harper.
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

122.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
122.text: You might as well lock the cell. You're too late.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

125.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
125.text: Tell me you bring good news.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Follow me. I'll lead you to safety.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Remind me what I should do.

8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
8.text: Unlock this cell and escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.

140.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
140.text: Then I can head to the city and gather allies.

168.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
168.text: Escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.

171.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
171.text: The city's future lies with us, then. We cannot rest until it is free from the Absolute's grip.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: I bring good news - Ravengard's safe.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I bring good news - Ravengard's safe.

13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
13.text: Truly? What fortune - then he might still be loosed from the Absolute's grasp!

0.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
0.text: You must get me free. My allies will want to hear the good news.

133.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
133.text: Jaheira? You're too late, High Harper.

149.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
149.text: Leave me to rot. But don't abandon our city.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I've changed my mind. I'll help you get to Baldur's Gate.

3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
3.text: I knew you would see light.

96.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
96.text: Please, free from this cell and lead me out of this prison.

60.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
60.text: I will gather allies. They will be invaluable in the fight to come.

137.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
137.text: Now you've unlocked the door, you can lead me from the prison.

175.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
175.text: Wyll? What has become of you?
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

178.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
178.text: Leave me to rot. But don't abandon our city.

181.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
181.text: Good - the cell's open. One step closer.

183.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
183.text: Good - the cell's open. One step closer.
183.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

184.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

187.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
187.text: Tell me you bring good news.
